IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of the National Civil War Museum is to serve as a national center to inspire lifelong learning of the American Civil War through the preservation and balanced presentation of the American peoples struggles for survival and healing. The Museum is dedicated to the preservation of material, culture and information related to the the American Civil War during the period of 1861 through 1865, and to offer exhibits, publications, educational programs and research activities to that period of American history.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of the National Civil War Museum is to serve as a national center to inspire lifelong learning of the American Civil War through the preservation and balanced presentation of the American peoples struggles for survival and healing. The Museum is dedicated to the preservation of material, culture and information related to the the American Civil War during the period of 1861 through 1865, and to offer exhibits, publications, educational programs and research activities to that period of American history.
IRS990.Desc: The Museum is dedicated to the preservation of material, culture and information related to the the American Civil War during the period of 1861 through 1865, and to offer exhibits, publications, educational programs and research activities to that period of American history. And to acquire various artifacts related to that period for display and to operate a facility for the exhibit of such artifacts including a storage facility to preserve these artifacts for future generations.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: City of Harrisburg Long Term In Kind Rent Contribution Receivable

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The National Civil War Museum acquires, for display, various artifacts related to the American Civil War and operates a facility for the exhibit of such items including a storage facility to preserve these artifacts for future generations. The Museum uses these collections for educational programs and exhibits relating to the American Civil War for the enjoyment and view of the general public.
The Museum intends to invest the funds in perpetuity for which the earnings & gains may be spent towards the overall betterment of the Museum.

The Museum follows the provisions of FASB's Income Tax Topic of the ASC, which requires an assessment of the Museum's exposure to income taxes at the entity level due to uncertain tax positions taken in current and previously-filed tax return. Presently, management believes that it is more likely than not that its tax positions will be sustained upon examination, including appeals and litigation, and therefore, management believes that the Museum has no exposure to income taxes arising from uncertain positions.
Fundraising expenses reported on Part VIII
Fundraising expenses reported on Part VIII

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The accounting services are outsourced to Charles E Bussard, CPA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A draft of the 990 is provided to the audit committee for review prior to filing. These committee members are the individuals on the board of directors who are familiar with the 990 filing and are able to provide a complete review. The audit committee recommends approval for the 990 filing to the full Board. The 990 is available for all the governing Board member to review.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest documents are submitted annually by the Board of Directors and when new members are approved. These documents are reviewed by the CEO and maintained for updates and revisions as needed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO is hired by the governing Board. The compensation package is reviewed and approved each year by the Executive Committee and recommended to the full Board. The compensation package is based on multiple factors including general economic, museum data, museum budgetary needs and information available concerning similar positions within the general industry.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Museum maintains public inspection copies as required. In addition to providing all public documents when requested, the Museum provides copies of the 990 and audit to the Commonwealth of Pa when filing the annual BCO reports. The Museum provides copies of the 990 filings along with audit documents to several funders when applying for mission support. These funders include, the Federal government, the City of Harrisburg, the County of Dauphin, the local United Way organization and various public and private Foundations.
City of Harrisburg In Kind rent expense based on long term lease agreement.
